page.title: 19Local History, Customs,Salem
page.content: The village of Salem was originally named Heol Galed (Hard Road). The main street was one of a network of Roman roads linking the gold mines at Caio with the various staging posts in the area. It was also on the Drovers route to mid Wales and the Marches- at one time there were four alehouses in the village! The name changed with time, by the use of 'Salem Heol Galed' when referring to the Chapel. Cock fighting took place at a pit sited between the Chapel and the Angel Inn. {CUSTOMS} -St. David's Day (dydd Gwyl Dewi Sant) on March 1st,is celebrated by the community. The children dress in traditional costume and many adults wear leeks or daffodils. Many local organisations hold folk concerts and suppers with national fare. The custom of 'First Footing' on 1st January is widely followed.
